alert.note: Alert for Horry (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 03 at 9:46AM EDT until further notice by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in South Carolina... Waccamaw River At Conway affecting Horry County. For the Waccamaw River...including Aiw At old Hwy 544 At Socastee, Conway, Above Conway, Freeland, Longs...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY EVENING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Waccamaw River at Conway. * WHEN...From Tuesday evening until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Flooding will worsen in Lees Landing, Riverfront South, Pitch Landing, and Savannah Bluff. Flooding will also worsen along Waccamaw Circle, Gray Oak Dr and Riverside Dr. Flood waters will begin to affect Black Moss Dr and Cypress Flat. Depot Rd, New Rd, and Jackson Bluff Rd may begin to flood. The lowest homes on Riverside Dr north of Conway may be affected. Witch Golf Course may begin to flood. Swamps will be heavily flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 AM EDT Sunday the stage was 10.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage Tuesday evening and continue rising to 12.2 feet early Friday morning. Additional rises are possible thereafter, and the river may not crest until the middle of September. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=ilm . The next statement will be issued by late tonight.
